message.content:
<<<api>>>: File.createNewFile
<<<code>>>: ArrayList<String> names = new ArrayList<>();
names.add("Stephen");
names.add("James");
names.add("Billy");
names.add("Connor");
names.add("Katie");

ArrayList<String> names2 = new ArrayList<>();
names2.add("Carlos");
names2.add("Katie");
names2.add("James");
names2.add("Cameron");
names2.add("Billy");

for (int i = 0; i < names.size(); i++) {
    if (names2.contains(names.get(i))) {
        int j = names2.indexOf(names.get(i));
        try {
            File file = new File("name " + j + ".txt");
            file.createNewFile();
            FileWriter writer = new FileWriter(file);
            writer.write(names.get(i));
            writer.close();
        } catch (IOException ex) {
            ex.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue in your code is that you are not checking the last name in the second arraylist. In your while loop condition, you are only checking if `j` is equal to `names2Size-1`, but you are not incrementing `j` after that. This causes the loop to get stuck and not check the last name. 
In the provided solution, I have used a for loop instead of a while loop to iterate over the names in the first arraylist. I then check if the name exists in the second arraylist using the `contains()` method. If it does, I get the index of the matching name using `indexOf()`. I then create a new file with the name "name j.txt" and write the matching name to the file using a FileWriter.
